titleStmt.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Testimony of Ruby Stanley

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Testimony of Ruby Stanley
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: I live at the star Spokane Falls Spokane County W.T. a the house of Ray Raymond have lived there 5 weeks the defdts house she is the proprietess was there on the night June 25th 1886 saw the dead man witnss have talked of

I was sitting in the middle parlor there was a noise in the hall I went to the door there was a gentalmen standing in the hall where I went there I said Miss Ray there is a Man in the hall, she came to the door ordered him out he refuseed to go out she ordered him out again he said he be dd if he would she stepped back in her bed room just out of the hall firy he said he be dis if he wanted he struck at her when she ordered him out they wrested a little bit she took him by the showlder and ordered him out again herefused to gostood he of her would then she went in her bed room the burean drawer was riht close there would only take a second to go in there I came back holing a book in by her side and ordered him out again he struck at her again and refused to go out
he refused to go out and she tried to get him to go out again she took him by the shoulde again and tried to get him out again and he struck her some where about the shoulder think it was on the right shoulder she drew back pointed the pistol and it went off then the man stood there he was shot I guess, he fell soon in the hall it is a small hall and he fell between the two dors, Think she dropped the Revolver and went to helping the man I shot you or hurt you and he said lay me down then she asked for water, a few minutes after that She helped to lay him down asked for water I did not get it for her and then the crowd gathered round i think she got water herself croud was gathering in front dont know who was first there when the crowd first came she was ringing her hands saying My God have I hurt you she usually kept her pistol on a empty chamber She did not show it know it would go off and did not mean to shoot the man, We lo He was there
there in Hall and had left the door partly open when he came in she tried to take him by the shoulder and get him to go out She tried to get past him to go out and she could not as the hall was small and he would not let her pass when she could not get by the man she stepped back as I described before when she first came out she asked him what he wanted there this was before she asked him to go out

I live at Raymonds street the Name of the house I was living at the Star up in the transome light is always burning at night the house that the prisoner keeps My Name is Ruby Stanley do dont not wish to answer my true name I told you before my name is Ruby Stanley

I told y I am known in Spokane Falls as Ruby Stanley I will be known in this proceding as Ruby Stanley I was rooming with the prisoner I testified before the Corners jury I swore to the whole truth I do know as I did say she scuffled with him said she took him by the shoulder though I did, I cant say for sure
that I did I testified as near as I could then I dont know I am sure I told you just as I remember it I dont remember what I testified to eveything was all afraid in the house an I was frightened very much I went to the door and told Miss Ray there was a Man in the hall had seen me came into the hall beforethis man I appeared as if he was drunk

I lived with ths prisoner that rooms of her board out I stood in the door all the while this was going on I did not bring watwe dont know who did I got the water for miss Ray when she fainted She was moving around a little bit when she was after her gun I saw sure that the man did not come for here, there is two halls most of his body fell in the small hall north hall lighted doors unlocked there is nother hall and the other side of the parlor has the star in of this door was looked the the star is could have been unlocked Ray could have done so and gone out was thwo men in the middle parlor the minutethis man come in the two men in the middle parlor steppped out the
they were there about as far as from her room door to the door in the Hall
I did see this man stgrike the Prisoner it is not a fact that the Prisoner has urged me to testify that the man struck her

The street door was open a little bit the outside door opens to the left and the mines door open same way the mines door was wide open both doors mines door would come back to the partition when open front door was open not quite open the mines door ws open He the man was in the small hall when he first came he came in the long hall I was not taken when I said but
before that he Was and out of the little Hall I did not a any time to say during my testimony that the man was went out of the little Hall Ruby Stanley
Sworn and subscribed beore me June 30 1886 JJL Peel JP
Ray pushed him back he was in the small Hall when the shooting took place when Ray weant for the Revolver he was right in the innerhall door when she came out with the Revolver she ordered him out he did npt see her ___ until after she pointed it at him after she came out with the Revolve
